author: William Boston
title: Germany Probes Bosch Employees Over Emissions Scandal
text:
BERLIN—A German prosecutor opened an investigation Wednesday into two employees of auto supplier Robert Bosch GmbH’s U.S. subsidiary on suspicion of aiding and abetting fraud in connection with a probe by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency into diesel emissions of Chrysler vehicles.
The office of the Stuttgart-based prosecutor said it had jurisdiction over the U.S. employees activities because of software work that was done in Germany on the engines of the 3-liter Chrysler Grand Cherokee and the Chrysler Dodge Ram 1500,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
